org.mpxj.primavera

Class StructuredTextParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mpxj.primavera.StructuredTextParser

  • public class StructuredTextParser
extends Object
    Parses structured text and returns a StructuredTextRecord representing the data encoded as structured text. See StructuredTextRecord for a brief description of the structured text format.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setRaiseExceptionOnParseError

        public void setRaiseExceptionOnParseError(boolean raiseExceptionOnParseError)
        By default, if unexpected structure is encountered while parsing structured text, the parser will raise a StructuredTextParseException. In some cases the structured text already parsed will have yielded useful data. Setting this flag to true will allow the parser to fail silently and return as much of the data as it has been able to extract.
        Parameters:
        raiseExceptionOnParseError - set to true to ignore structure errors

      • parse

        public StructuredTextRecord parse(InputStream is)
        Parse structured text from an InputStream and return the resulting data. The default character set (Windows 1252) is used.
        Parameters:
        is - InputStream instance
        Returns:
        StructuredTextRecord instance

      • parse

        public StructuredTextRecord parse(InputStream is,
                                  Charset charset)
        Parse structured text from an InputStream and return the resulting data. The caller supplies the character set to be used.
        Parameters:
        is - InputStream instance
        charset - character set to use
        Returns:
        StructuredTextRecord instance

      • parse

        public StructuredTextRecord parse(String text)
        Parse structured text from a String and return the resulting data.
        Parameters:
        text - String containing structured text
        Returns:
        StructuredTextRecord instance
